name: I. Project Overview
content:
Objective

The objective of the CPG-Customer-Segmentation project is to segment consumer packaged goods (CPG) customers into meaningful groups based on their purchasing behavior, demographics, coupon usage, and campaign responsiveness. The primary business question being addressed is: “How can we better understand customer heterogeneity to optimize marketing strategies, increase engagement, and drive incremental sales?”

By identifying distinct customer groups, retailers and manufacturers can personalize campaigns, optimize promotions, and tailor product assortments to specific segments.

Approach

The project will follow a structured data science workflow:

  1. Data Integration: Merge transaction data, household demographics, product details, campaign data, and coupon usage into a unified dataset.
  2. Data Preparation: Clean and transform data, handle missing values, engineer behavioral features, and normalize values where necessary.
  3. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Perform data profiling and visualization to identify key patterns and customer trends.
  4. Modeling: Apply clustering techniques (e.g., KMeans, Gaussian Mixture Models, or Hierarchical Clustering) to segment households based on purchase behavior and demographics.
  5. Evaluation: Assess clustering quality using metrics such as Silhouette Score and business interpretability.
  6. Insights & Application: Translate clusters into actionable business strategies for marketing, promotions, and customer relationship management.

Significance

Customer segmentation is a cornerstone of modern CPG analytics. It allows businesses to:

  • Shift from mass marketing to personalized strategies.
  • Understand differences in coupon redemption, price sensitivity, and campaign responsiveness.
  • Improve promotional ROI by targeting the right households with the right offers.

Benefits

  • Financial: Increase campaign ROI through targeted promotions.
  • Operational: Optimize distribution of coupons and campaign resources.
  • Strategic: Enable data-driven decision-making for product launches, assortments, and cross-selling opportunities.
  • Customer-centricity: Deliver personalized experiences that strengthen brand loyalty.

Expected Outcomes

  • Identification of 3–6 distinct customer segments with clear behavioral and demographic profiles.
  • Segment-level insights into campaign responsiveness, coupon redemption, and product preferences.
  • An actionable framework for personalized marketing campaigns.
  • Improved forecasting of customer responses to future campaigns.
